Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Use signatures or heuristics to detect malicious software.
Application: Consider utilizing the Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI) on Windows 10 to analyze commands after being processed/interpreted.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has hashed most its code's functions and encrypted payloads with base64 and XOR.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Enforce binary and application integrity with digital signature verification to prevent untrusted code from executing.
Application: Require signed binaries.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) mimics filenames from %SYSTEM%\System32 to hide DLLs in %WINDIR% and/or %TEMP%.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Block execution of code on a system through application whitelisting, blacklisting, and/or script blocking.
Application: Use tools that restrict program execution via whitelisting by attributes other than file name for common operating system utilities that are needed.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) mimics filenames from %SYSTEM%\System32 to hide DLLs in %WINDIR% and/or %TEMP%.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Block execution of code on a system through application whitelisting, blacklisting, and/or script blocking.
Application: Identify and block potentially malicious software executed through this technique by using application whitelisting tools capable of preventing unknown DLLs from being loaded.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can load a DLL using the LoadLibrary API.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Block execution of code on a system through application whitelisting, blacklisting, and/or script blocking.
Application: Adversaries install new AppCertDLL binaries to execute this technique. Identify and block potentially malicious software executed through AppCertDLLs functionality by using application whitelisting tools, like Windows Defender Application Control, AppLocker, or Software Restriction Policies where appropriate.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can establish using a AppCertDLLs Registry key.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Block execution of code on a system through application whitelisting, blacklisting, and/or script blocking.

Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can establish using a AppCertDLLs Registry key.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Use capabilities to detect and block conditions that may lead to or be indicative of a software exploit occurring.
Application: Microsoft's Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Attack Surface Reduction (ASR) feature can be used to block methods of using rundll32.exe to bypass whitelisting.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can load a DLL using Rundll32.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Use capabilities to detect and block conditions that may lead to or be indicative of a software exploit occurring.
Application: Microsoft's Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit (EMET) Attack Surface Reduction (ASR) feature can be used to block methods of using rundll32.exe to bypass whitelisting.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can load a DLL using Rundll32.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion prevention or data loss prevention tools may be set to block specific file types from leaving the network over unencrypted channels. An adversary may move to an encrypted channel or use other mechanisms of encapsulating the traffic in these situations.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has Gzipped information and saved it to a random temp file before exfil.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems that use network signatures to identify traffic for specific adversary malware can be used to mitigate activity at the network level.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) enables remote interaction and can obtain additional code over HTTPS GET and POST requests.

Software Description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) is a backdoor malware used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) that has been observed targeting POS networks in the hospitality industry. (Citation: Morphisec ShellTea June 2019)(Citation: FireEye Fin8 May 2016) (Citation: FireEye Know Your Enemy FIN8 Aug 2016)
Mitigation Description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.
Application: Network intrusion detection and prevention systems that use network signatures to identify traffic for specific adversary malware or unusual data transfer over known tools and protocols like FTP can be used to mitigate activity at the network level. Signatures are often for unique indicators within protocols and may be based on the specific obfuscation technique used by a particular adversary or tool, and will likely be different across various malware families and versions. Adversaries will likely change tool C2 signatures over time or construct protocols in such a way as to avoid detection by common defensive tools.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can download additional files and payloads to compromised hosts.

Mitigation Description: Restrict access by setting directory and file permissions that are not specific to users or privileged accounts.
Application: Use file system access controls to protect folders such as C:\\Windows\\System32.
Use: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) mimics filenames from %SYSTEM%\System32 to hide DLLs in %WINDIR% and/or %TEMP%.
